channel.title: Comments on: Converting a mapped drive letter to a network path using C#

item.title: By: Aaron
item.dc:creator: Aaron
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/blog/index.php/archives/22/comment-page-1#comment-4591">Suggestor</a>.
While that's true it would be more correct, on Windows, it's hard coded in the .NET 4.0 framework to be a ":". :)
(And this call wouldn't make sense on anything but Windows with a mapped drive letter, so portability really isn't an issue).
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Suggestor.

While that’s true it would be more correct, on Windows, it’s hard coded in the .NET 4.0 framework to be a “:”. :)

(And this call wouldn’t make sense on anything but Windows with a mapped drive letter, so portability really isn’t an issue).

item.title: By: Suggestor
item.dc:creator: Suggestor
item.description:
Should use this:
IO.Path.VolumeSeparatorChar
instead of a hard-coded ":"c

item.title: By: Michael
item.dc:creator: Michael
item.description: Wouldn't it be easier to use the WNetGetUniversalName API?
item.content:encoded: Wouldn’t it be easier to use the WNetGetUniversalName API?
